creditline: The Siri and Bob Marshall Endowment for American Paintings
description: view over calm lake with mountain in background; green landforms with trees at left and right; rocks and grass in LLC; a few clouds in URQ
medium: Oil on paper laid down on panel
text: David Johnson aspired to present views of nature he had witnessed with great clarity and a quality of light that makes them appear to glow. He worked through the styles and approaches of other artists who gave him lessons in his youth before finding his own voice. It is evident here in the sense of calm and sensitivity to atmosphere that brought him admiration from the public and critics.
title: Bear Mountain and Iona Island on the Hudson River
